intro: Pyrenaria hirta, commonly known as the hairy pyrenaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Pyrenaria hirta is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
